tool.name: linearmosaic
tool.shortdescription: combining images in a weighted fashion

method.name: defineoutputimage
method.shortdescription: Set the output direction image parameters and name
method.description:
Define the direction axes output image parameters. The output image will get the same number of spectral and polarization planes as the input images. This function create a fresh new output image. If an image of the same name exist on disk it will be erased. The spectral and polarization part of the image will be identical to the images that are being mosaiced.
The output image will by default be flux correct and the weight image will be ${\sum_p A_p^2(\theta)}$ where the primary beam is $ A_p(\theta)$

param.name: nx
param.description: Total number of spatial pixels in x

param.name: ny
param.description: Total number of spatial pixels in y

param.name: imagecenter
param.description: Direction of phase center as a diretion measure

method.name: setoutputimage
method.shortdescription: Use this function to mosaic on an existing image and weight image
method.description:
Use this function if the mosaicing is to be done onto a previous mosaic or image. For now the stokes and spectral characteristic of the images to be mosaic and the output image has to be similar (i.e the user has to regrid them prior to linearmosaic if necessary). The weightimage represents the sensitivity image of the image (for example the weighted primary beam coverage of a mosaic)
{\tt imageweighttype} parameter:
If the image is of the type that has been normalized to be flux correct then the imageweighttype should 0. If the image has been apodized by a primary beam then imageweighttype should be 1 and if the image is multiplied by $PB^2$ then it should be 2.
{\tt weighttype} parameter: This should be 1 if the weight image is the sum of Primary beams or equivalent and it should be 2 if it is the sum of of $PB^2$

param.name: imageweighttype
param.description:
what kind of weight was already applied to image 
 0: flux correct 
 1: Primary beam equivalent weight 
 2: $PB^2$ equivalent weight

param.name: weighttype
param.description:
what kind of weight is weight image 
 1: Primary beam equivalent weight 
 2: $PB^2$ equivalent

method.name: saultweightimage
method.shortdescription: Use this function to create a Sault-weighted image
method.description: "Sault weighted" image is one which is more pleasant to view (without high noise at the edges of mosaic images), it is flux correct upto a where the beam coverage becomes low and is tapered off onwards just to keep the noise from rising in the overall image(see Eq[2] from Sault, Staveley-Smith and Brouw (1996), Astron. Astrophys. Suppl, 120, 375)

param.name: outputimage
param.description: Name of image to create the Sault-Weighted image

param.name: fracpeak
param.description: Upto what fraction of peak of coverage should the image be flux correct

method.example: lm.defineoutputimage(nx=3000, cellx='3arcsec', imagecenter='19h13m13.469 4d50m09.649', outputimage='test.linmos') lm.makemosaic(images=['FIELD_31/img.image', 'FIELD_33/img.image'], weightimages=['FIELD_31/img.pb', 'FIELD_33/img.pb']) ###the above will make a flux correct mosaic of the 2 images in a flux correct fashion in test.linmos #Now make a Sault weighted image to use in the viewer lm.saultweightimage('test_sault.linmos')

method.name: setlinmostype
method.shortdescription: Use this function to set if you want to mosaic in flatnoise domain

param.name: linmostype
param.description: Type of weighting for linear mosaic

method.name: makemosaic
method.shortdescription: mosaic images in a weighted fashion onto ouput image
method.description: Put the list of images onto the mosaic image using the weight images

param.name: imageweighttype
param.description:
what kind of weight is already applied to image 
 0: flux correct 
 1: Primary beam equivalent weight 
 2: PB^2 equivalent

param.name: weighttype
param.description:
what kind of weight image it is 
 1: Primary beam equivalent weight 
 2: PB^2 equivalent

method.example:
lm.defineoutputimage(nx=3000, cellx='3arcsec', imagecenter='19h13m13.469 4d50m09.649', outputimage='test.linmos')
###make a mosaic of two fields lm.makemosaic(images=['FIELD_31/img.image', 'FIELD_33/img.image'], weightimages=['FIELD_31/img.pb', 'FIELD_33/img.pb'])
####now we have another submosaic (which is flux corrected) we want to add to this mosaic
lm.makemosaic(images='submosaic.image', weightimages='submosaic.flux', imageweighttype=0, weighttype=1)
